name: 黃少妤
objective: Since the mid-twentieth century, there is evidence of a substantial shift in the centre of debates within architecture and its relationship with other academic disciplines, particularly with cultural studies and philosophy. It, however, was a reciprocal process. Not only are architects and architectural theorists becoming close to ideas of cultural theory, but significant numbers of cultural theorists, philosophers and sociologists are to be found highly engaged with questions of architecture and the built environment. Yet, recently, it has been found that architects and architecture students may confront struggling to deeply navigate those thinkers’ work resulting in unexpected distances and hazes between disciplines. Therefore, there are two intentions for forming this module. Firstly, it attempts to introduce architecture to a broader cultural context and consider how debates from cultural theory might begin to inform a discussion about architecture (Leach 1997). scorePolicy:
> Final essay report (50%): 
Each student gives a summary presentation and a 2500-3000 words essay to answer some specific critical questions based on the selected philosopher.

>Topic report (30%): 
An oral presentation: to demonstrate the understanding of the theory that has been introduced in one of the classes.
  
>Class attendance (20%):
The excused absence with advance notice is acceptable.
(PG students two times only, UG students four times only)
The layout of the final report must meet the basic academic requirements, and the final report should include the title, keywords, related visual information and other items which will be provided in more detail in the class.
